CANDIDATE   Antonio Aulicino  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
 
Location:   Italy – Rome  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
MSc Chemical Engineering - Università degli Studi di Napoli, Federico II 2010  
Grade: 110/110 cum laude and awarded as 3rd best student. Thesis: absorption of 
benzene in an aqueous solution of block amphiphilic copolymers. He studied 
innovative methods to reduce the VOC emissions with an aqueous solution. After 
laboratory measurements to assess the thermodynamic of the benzene absorption in 
the innovative solution, he designed and built a pilot scale absorption column to 
develop a dedicat ed simulation model.  
 
BSc Chemical Engineering Università degli Studi di Napoli, Federico II 2007  
Grade: 110/110 cum laude Thesis: Common and innovative techniques to dispose 
urban solid wastes. I studied the various techniques available with a particular focus 
to waste to energy plants and their environmental impact.  
 
Additional Courses  
• Corporate strategy in platform ecosystems – Umbria Business School.  
• Game Theory – Stanford University (via Coursera).  
• Effective decision making: dealing with business complexity – Delft University 
of Technology (via EDX).  
• Successful negotiation: essential strategy and skills – University of Michigan 
(via Coursera).  
• Finance for non finance professional - Rice University (via Coursera).  
• New product development – Technion Israel Insti tute of Technology (via 
Coursera).  
• Body language for leaders – LinkedIn Learning.  
• English Course – OISE School in Cambridge.  
• Public speaking Course.  
• Counsellor sales person Course.  
• Marketing Course.  
 
Languages  
Italian: Mother tongue  
English : Fluent  
 
 
  
    
CAREER SUMMARY  
 
June 2018 to date Exolon Group SpA (formerly Co vestro Sp A) 
Position: Product Manager  
• Product management of polycarbonate multiwall sheets.  
• Strategic marketing.  
• Cooperation with R&D for new products developments.  
• Inventor of a patent pending innovative she et to maximize energy savings.  
• Cooperation with the sales organization to boost the value creation and the 
value delivery of the Company’s products and services.  
• Strategy for: pricing, applications, markets.  
• Development of post controlling tools to b etter drive the business.  
• Identification of market trends.  
• Strategic assessments for the identification of long -term partnerships and 
acquisitions.  
• Organization of webinars, seminars, workshops, conferences to promote the 
knowledge transfer both inte rnally and externally.  
 
Apr 2016 to May 2018 Matrica SpA  
Position: Product Manager and Business Development  
• Product management of specialty chemicals from renewable raw materials.  
• Strategic marketing.  
• Business development to penetrate with innovative chemicals worldwide 
markets, with a particular focus to: Europe, Far East, Austral ia, USA.  
• Market development for innovative green chemicals, with a particular focus to: 
polymers, lubricants, cosmetics, agrochemicals, metalworking fluids.  
• Organization of webinars, seminars, workshops, conferences to promote 
innovative, environmental ly friendly solutions.  
 
Mar 2010 to Mar 2016 Chimec Sp A 
 
Mar 2014 to Mar 2016  
Position: Product Manager  
• Product management of performance chemicals for the petrochemical industry.  
• Cooperation with the sales organization to boost the value creation and the 
value delivery of the Company’s products and services.  
• Identification of market trends.  
• Cooperation with R&D for new products developments.  
• Development of an innovative method that combines laboratory measurements 
with mathematical models to predict crude oil compatibilities and minimize 
process criticalities.  
• Development  of software solutions to monitor and optimize chemical 
treatments and minimize energy consumptions.
